did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle:
Papers of the President of the University of Virginia, Office Administrative Files
1937-1938

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Access restrictions may apply to specific student records under the terms of the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (F.E.R.P.A.).

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
See the
University of Virginia Library’s use policy.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers of the President of the University of Virginia, Office Administrative Files, Accession #RG-2/1/2.491, III, Special Collections, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: These files constitute the major record series generated by the president of the University of Virginia. The records consist chiefly of correspondence, but also include reports, minutes, clippings, memoranda, and related papers concerning all areas of business of the president's office.

did.unittitle: "A" Miscellaneous (Albemarle Agriculture Society meetings; Department of Agriculture Celebration; Wallace speech; Mrs. Alderman correspondence-- re: Life of Alderman; American Council on Education--minutes of meetings; Associated Clubs for Virginia--Billboard Bill; Lady Astor -correspondence re: gift of squash courts) 1937-1938
Alumni Board--Correspondence of Tunstall re: founding of Alumni Board 1937-1938
Art--Bayly Art Museum (Indian Collection Gift; Annual Report) 1937-1938
Articles on UVa. ( Cavalcadearticles; Lifepictures and article; statistics) 1937-1938
Astronomy (Cut in McCormick money; Report on Work of Department; Expedition with National Geographic Society; Enderberry Island Eclipse) 1937-1938
Athletics (Resigns from Southern Conference; correspondence of Beverley Tucker) 1937-1938
"B" Miscellaneous (1 of 2) (UVa. Band--lack of support; A. Balz--semester calendar recommended; Stringfellow Barr--why he goes to Annapolis) 1937-1938
"B" Miscellaneous (2 of 2) (Harry Byrd and J. S. Bryan--correspondence of 2 University Presidents) 1937-1938
Bursar (2 folders) (Report on investments of the Centennial Fund and Jefferson Memorial Fund of the University of Virginia, 1935) 1937-1938

"C" Miscellaneous (2 folders) (Cemetery--Report of Committee; Society of the Cincinnati--Report on Medal; College Topics--Petition; Committees of the Faculty--Administrative lists; College-- Committee Report; Corbitt, James H.--Correspondence--official and personal) 1937-1938
Church Society for College Work (call for meetings) 1937-1938
Commons (should buy pasteurizing plant if possible) 1937-1938
English (Sadlier Collection of Gothic Romances and Tales of Terror) 1937-1938
Forestry (outline of plans for school on grounds of UVa.) 1937-1938
German Scholars--Emergency Committee on Aid of 1937-1938

"H" Miscellaneous (Hampton History--recordings of ex-slaves; Sidney B. Hall--cooperation of state colleges, reciprocal relations with Havana; Oskar Hansen--Film Library service, desire to carve T.J. memorial; J.E.N. Hume--Memorial Fountain) 1937-1938

History (suggested Commission on British Colonial Documents; Stringfellow Barr and his relationship to University of Chicago; re-grading final exams; resignation of R.H.Dabney; Reorganization of Dept. of History) 1937-1938

Institute of Public Affairs (2 folders)--correspondence of the Assistant Secretary of State--criticism of the Administration and the Institute; Death of Maphis; Gooch appointed as Director; Memorial to Maphis; Spencer Miller--speech, 1937) 1937-1938
Interracial Cooperation--Virginia Commission (annuities; space in Library for Negro people; L. R. Reynolds correspondence) 1937-1938
Invitations to be represented (2 folders) (Centennials, conferences, interracial meetings) 1937-1938
Jefferson Memorial Foundation (report to Board of Governors) 1937-1938
Jefferson School of American Government (letters from supporters in Congress) 1937-1938
Law Department (Munford Boyd's recommendation; Alger Hiss to speak) 1937-1938
Legal Papers (W. A. Perkins, attorney--annexation proceedings) 1937-1938
Legal Papers (W. A. Perkins, attorney--"Estate of Conrad Hubert") 1937-1938
Legal Papers (W. A. Perkins, attorney--Lizzie Miller Farm) 1937-1938
Legislative Program (statement of certain urgent needs of UVa. to be presented to Governor Peery) 1937-1938
Library--General (2-3of 3) (Dumas Malone--speaker at dedication of Library; lists of dedication ceremony guests; Library Committee meeting minutes) 1937-1938
"M" Miscellaneous (Chapin W. Maupin--gift of grandfather clock) 1937-1938
Medical Department (outline of Student Health Service; Death of Dr. Neff and replacement suggestions) 1937-1938
Medical Department--Student Health Service (report of Dept. of Student health; 1st Annual Budget) 1937-1938
Medical School (information for Ms. Lape, American Foundation) 1937-1938
"N" Miscellaneous (National Research Council--fellowships; National Association of State Universities; Hutchins-Dewey Clash) 1937-1938
National Youth Administration (placement statistics; Student Aid Program) 1937-1938
National Association of University Presidents (criticisms of accrediting agencies) 1937-1938
Public Administration, Bureau of (Committee: Kincaid, Snavely, Ribble, Spicer, Egger) 1937-1938
"R" Miscellaneous (Raven Society--election speakers; Richardson, Eudora Ramsey--Charlottesville Manuscript, folklore, W.P.A.) 1937-1938
Rhodes Fellowships and Scholarships (statistics; letters from Gooch) 1937-1938

"S" Miscellaneous (3 folders) (Schwartz, A.--song "Virginia"; Seal of Virginia--records; Sigma Xi--President's and Visitors' prize; Slaughter, Jane--Letter about John Page; Slemp, C. Bascom-- collection of pictures and prizes; Southern Historical Association Quarterly--articles; Stettinius, E.--boxbushes) 1937-1938
Social Sciences, Institute for Research in (agenda) 1937-1938

"T" Miscellaneous (Bernard P. Taylor--Stone Collection; Tome School--reorganization recommendation; H. Trout--Rotunda restoration; Beverley Tucker--interest in students, Nuckols Scholarship; Robert Tunstall--Stone Library, McGregor Library) 1937-1938
Virginia Quarterly Review(financial reports; change in editor [Davis to Lee]; Conditions of position offered; Annual reports) 1937-1938
Visitors--meetings (James L. Minor--scholarship; New library; Honor System--Meisel case; R. H. Dabney resignation; "Pantop") 1937-1938

"W" Miscellaneous (William H. White--report to President on effect on Salaries of Supreme Court decision; J. E. Williams--"Preparation for College"; Frances M. Williams--Rembrandt Peale portrait of Jefferson; Jennings S. Wise--help for UVa. from Mr. Mellon; Wood, R. H.--moving Tablet) 1937-1938
